intro: Pentace corneri, commonly known as the African star tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Pentace corneri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
